subject: Economics
title: Bargaining Theory: Who Gets the Bigger Slice?
description: A short lesson to help you apply Bargaining Theory: Who Gets the Bigger Slice?.

hook.text: Two people must split $100. If they can't agree, both get nothing.

buildup.text: Nash's bargaining solution says the split depends on each person's 'outside option'.

discovery.text: A job candidate with another offer negotiates harder. A country with alternative trading partners gets better deals.

twist.text: Patience is power. In the Rubinstein bargaining model, the player who can afford to wait longer gets a larger share.

climax.text: Bargaining power isn't about shouting. It's about alternatives, patience, and information.

punchline.text: In any negotiation, the person who needs the deal least gets the best terms.

quiz.question: What determines bargaining power according to Nash's theory?
